context: The word 'kellel' is an Estonian interrogative pronoun that means 'whose' or 'to whom'. It is in the adessive case, which typically indicates location or possession. In questions about ownership or possession of something, 'kellel' would be used to ask who has or owns something. For example, 'Kellel on see raamat?' means 'Whose book is this?'. It can also indicate direction toward someone in certain contexts.
